page.title: 07Fairfield Primary School
page.content: Fairfield Primary School was built on meadowland with a beautiful field surrounding it, and has a good view of Penarth. When it was opened on the 13th.April 1953 there were 256 children and 8 staff. There were 3 Infant classes and 3 Junior classes. In 1966 there was an annex built for children with special learning difficulties. Now in 1985 there are 197 children, 9 staff, a Welsh teacher,remedial reading teacher and secretary all of whom work part time, plus 2 Nursery assistants. Our school is lively and interesting, with good sport and educational facilities. We have a very active P.T.A. who help us to buy important equipment. Every year we have concerts, school trips, discos and parties. We play netball, football and baseball and we won the 1984-5 football league trophy.
